net.canarymod.backbone

Class BackboneUsers

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.canarymod.backbone.Backbone
      • net.canarymod.backbone.BackboneUsers

  • public class BackboneUsers
extends Backbone
    Backbone to the Player System. This contains NO logic, it is only the data source access!
    Author:
    Chris (damagefilter)

      • addUser

        public void addUser(java.lang.String nameOrUUID,
                    java.lang.String group)
        Used to update a player. This can not override existing player entries. If there is a player with the uuid name, nothing will happen
        Parameters:
        nameOrUUID - the player's name or uuid
        group - the group's name

      • userExists

        Get whether a user exists
        Parameters:
        uuid - Player to check if they exist.
        Returns:
        true if user exists, false otherwise

      • loadUsers

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> loadUsers()
        Load and return String array sets. Each Array in the hashMap value has prefix, group and isMuted for a player, in that order.
        Returns:
        A hashmap with a key of player name, and string array value with a prefix and group for a player, in that order.

      • getModularGroups

        public Group[] getModularGroups(java.lang.String uuid)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Group array

      • validateUsers

        public void validateUsers()
        Validate all user entries in the database. At this time it merely checks that all entries have a valid UUID. If an entry does not, it attempts to retrieve it from Mojang's web service and
